channel.title: L4D2 Texture Help (Models, too, possibly)
channel.description:
Hiya, I'm working on a Left 4 Dead 2 mod that my sister suggested (that makes 3 projects, only 2 actually going anywhere), and have a whole level completely orange-mapped, one level half-laid out, and the rest at zero percent. I keep stopping because I really want to find textures that work with the project I'm doing, which is called [COLOR='Red'][b]The Crimson Chapel[/b].
I need some textures that really fit the setting and look like... well, what this place is supposed to be.
Before I go on and name exactly what kind of textures I'm looking for, I'm going to wait and see if anybody catches what I'm doing based on the name of the Campaign.
A hint: The fact that the name is Crimson has nothing to do with the fact that a motif of L4D is lotsa blood'n'guts, it just happens to be a well-placed accidental double-entendre.
Addendum: At a later date, I might ask for some help with models as well, such as some arched doorjambs and pillars.
[COLOR='Gray']NOTE: Anybody who does contribute (if anybody contributes), just also send me a decal with your name and what you did on it, and I'll toss it in somewhere.[/SIZE]
UPDATE: Okay, I figure now I might as well say what it's a remake of: The Scarlet Monastery.

item.title: L4D2 Texture Help (Models, too, possibly)
item.dc:creator: Madcat1030
item.description:
Hiya, I’m working on a Left 4 Dead 2 mod that my sister suggested (that makes 3 projects, only 2 actually going anywhere), and have a whole level completely orange-mapped, one level half-laid out, and the rest at zero percent. I keep stopping because I really want to find textures that work with the project I’m doing, which is called [COLOR=‘Red’]The Crimson Chapel.

I need some textures that really fit the setting and look like… well, what this place is supposed to be.

Before I go on and name exactly what kind of textures I’m looking for, I’m going to wait and see if anybody catches what I’m doing based on the name of the Campaign.

A hint: The fact that the name is Crimson has nothing to do with the fact that a motif of L4D is lotsa blood’n’guts, it just happens to be a well-placed accidental double-entendre.

Addendum: At a later date, I might ask for some help with models as well, such as some arched doorjambs and pillars.

[COLOR=‘Gray’]NOTE: Anybody who does contribute (if anybody contributes), just also send me a decal with your name and what you did on it, and I’ll toss it in somewhere.[/SIZE]

UPDATE: Okay, I figure now I might as well say what it’s a remake of: The Scarlet Monastery.
